âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good reverse clash, not instantly obvious but write statement gives good clue.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: A unique pattern to recognize, easy solution to implement
Definitely a unique pattern to look for, but I wonder if that might just be frustrating because the solution to the puzzle is so different from people normally look for in CoC

This is what the player will see in reverse mode:

Test A: 123457 â†’ 0
Test B: 100000 â†’ 5
Test C: 0 â†’ 1
Test D: 96 â†’ 2
Test E: 699 â†’ 3
Test F: 1960 â†’ 3
Test G: 8888 â†’ 8
Test H: 80008 â†’ 7
Test I: 123456789 â†’ 4
Test J: 608128830 â†’ 9

Update: Inserted shorter test cases, swapped some numbers.

Thanks for approving. Reverse puzzles are really hard to gauge. I'm optimistic because it turns out there's already a similar clash (not reverse), so someone else had the exact same idea. Hopefully the hint of printing "loops" in the stub code is enough for those who might get stuck. Of course, if it gets downvoted after play, it will be removed. I'd presume people tend to love reverse puzzles if it clicks and they get it, and hate them otherwise. The goal of course is to introduce puzzles where they get it.
